results.title: Industrial provinces of Canada
results.brief_description: Ontario and Quebec, as the main industrial provinces of Canada, link Canada with the United States of America, and with the rest of the world, through the products of their industries. Mining, manufacturing, and agriculture in these two provinces make them vitally important to the well-being of the other Canadian provinces.

results.title: Industrial preparation of acetic acid (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV and Barrie Whatley
results.brief_description: Describes the process of making acetic acid, by the oxidation of naphtha with air, in a large industrial chemicals factory. Outlines the various stages in developing the process, including laboratory research and pilot plant development.
results.description: Describes the process of making acetic acid, by the oxidation of naphtha with air, in a large industrial chemicals factory. Outlines the various stages in developing the process, including laboratory research and pilot plant development.

results.title: Industrial power service
results.brief_description: An outline of the characteristics and advantages of pneumatic power across a wide range of industries. Shows how air tools can perform a wide range of tasks from polishing to rivetting.

results.title: Industrial Mysore. Series 2
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and Jagat Murari
results.brief_description: A further report on Mysore and its products, including carvings in sandalwood and ivory, inlay work, sugar, paper from bamboo pulp, textiles and soap. Work in the Kojar goldfields is shown in some detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and Jagat Murari

results.title: Industrial Mysore. Series 1
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and Jagat Murari
results.brief_description: Mysore is one of the most highly industrialised states in India. Works include the Mysore Iron and Steel Works; the Krishnasagar Dam, where the river Kaveri has been harnessed; Sivasamundrum and Jog Falls; the state-owned porcelain works and power generating station; the aircraft industry and a factory for manufacturing telephones and electronic equipment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and Jagat Murari
results.description: Mysore is one of the most highly industrialised states in India. results.title: Industrial journey
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Fred Clarke
results.brief_description: Surveys Tasmania’s secondary industries, transportation system, and hydro-electric power scheme. Includes carpet and paper mills, zinc and cement works the Mt Lyle copper mines, an aluminium plant, canned frozen and dried food factories. Shows how the ferry service to the mainland handles goods economically as road transports drive on board with their cargo.

results.title: Industrial Japan
results.brief_description: Japan’s economical growth is approximately 10% per year. Japan’s growth in the second half of the 20th century has been described as a miracle. Poorly endowed with raw materials it depends heavily upon its greatest assset - its people. They have developed industrial skills of the highest level and are applying them to the wide range of modern industry which make up the nation’s economic life.

results.title: Industrial design
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Discusses the part played by the industrial designer in bringing new designs onto the market, the various factors involved, and the type of training needed.

results.title: Industrial dermatitis
results.brief_description: Methods of prevention and cure of industrial dermatitis, as shown through the work of a new Medical Officer at a factory where the disease is prevalent.
